title: Crazy Low Competition KDP Niche + FREE Keywords

tactics.name: BSR Validation
tactics.description: Verify niche viability by checking best sellers ranks on Amazon
steps: Use DS Amazon Quick View plugin
source_quotes: I look for three or more books on the first page with best sellers ranks of less than 300,000

tactics.name: Keyword Competition Check
tactics.description: Analyze Amazon search results to identify low-competition niches with sales potential
steps: Extract keywords from Amazon search suggestions
Use AMZ Suggestion Expander for additional terms
Check Amazon search result counts (target 1000 or less)
Cross-reference with Google monthly search volume
caveats: Requires SEO optimization beyond keyword inclusion
source_quotes: I look for search results of 1000 or less
we can see here from the best sellers rank, this one here, 59,087,000 151,000

tactics.name: public_domain_images
tactics.description: Use free public domain images from the Met Museum for Spot the Difference books
steps: Check if images are public domain via metmuseum.org
Verify with Google reverse image search
source_quotes: There's plenty of images out there and it's not worth getting stressed...

heuristics.name: BSR Averaging
heuristics.condition: If average BSR of first page results is below 50,000, prioritize niche
source_quotes: Work out the average best sellers rank on the first page of search results

heuristics.name: Low Competition Filter
heuristics.condition: If search results are 1000 or less then boost keyword potential
source_quotes: I look for search results of 1000 or less

claims.statement: Medium content books receive free ISBNs from KDP
source_quotes: These books are medium content books, which means you do get a free ISBN from KDP

claims.statement: Low-competition niches with search results under 1000 can still have active sales
source_quotes: we can see here from the best sellers rank, this one here, 59,087,000 151,000

claims.statement: Met Museum images are often in the public domain
source_quotes: many of them, if not most of them, are in the public domain

niche_patterns.description: Combine niche identity with competitive constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages low competition while maintaining sales potential
source_quotes: There's lots of interesting, very low competition sub niches within this overall niche

niche_patterns.example: Spot the Difference arts masterpieces + low competition + free resources
niche_patterns.description: Leverage public domain images to create low-competition niche books
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Free resources reduce production costs and competition
source_quotes: There's plenty of images out there and it's not worth getting stressed...
